availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William P. Duvall (Scott County, KY, trader)

body.p: Scott County, Kentucky, trader. Kentucky native. Son of John Duvall and Jane Duvall. Married to Caroline Robinson Duvall in Scott County, Kentucky, on October 4, 1855. Father of George E. Duvall and Irene J. Duvall. Lawyer in Scott County in 1850. Household owned twelve enslaved persons in Scott County in 1850. Trader in Scott County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 2, p. 479B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 2, p. 31.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 1, p. 938.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Scott County Marriages, Film 000183225, p. 117.
